intro: Racosperma microbotryum, commonly known as the small-fruited acacia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring bipinnate leaves and yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its seeds are enclosed in small, leathery pods, and it is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Racosperma microbotryum plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and animals.
